physical_appearance:This is a black-and-white portrait photograph. It features a man
 dressed in elaborately designed attire
 with wrap cloth and hat. He is wearing several accessories around his neck
 and is seated on a raised platform. He is facing forward
 with his hands on his knees. The photograph is quite faded and stained. There are no inscriptions
 tears
 or folds seen.

sgcool_label_text:\This is part of a series of small carte de visite format portrait photographs by August Sachtler
 a German photographer who started photographing in Singapore in the early 1860s. The studio details inscribed on the back of these cartes de visite read \\A. Sachtler in Singapore\\

metadata.title_text: Series of six carte de visite portraits by August Sachtler Photograph of  Sultan Hamengkubowono VI of Yogyakarta
metadata.physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white portrait photograph. It features a man, dressed in elaborately designed attire, with wrap cloth and hat. He is wearing several accessories around his neck, and is seated on a raised platform. He is facing forward, with his hands on his knees. The photograph is quite faded and stained. There are no inscriptions, tears, or folds seen.
metadata.subject_terms_1: indigenous people ways of life folk costume kings (people) portraits
metadata.subject_terms_2: Carte de visite photographs Portrait photography Indigenous people Lifestyles Ethnic costume Sultans
metadata.sgcool_label_text: "This is part of a series of small carte de visite format portrait photographs by August Sachtler, a German photographer who started photographing in Singapore in the early 1860s. The studio details inscribed on the back of these cartes de visite read ""A. Sachtler in Singapore""
